pkgmetadata.longdescription: The Unidentified Flying Raw (UFRaw) is a utility to read and manipulate raw images from digital cameras. It can be used on its own or as a Gimp plug-in. It reads raw images using Dave Coffin's raw conversion utility - DCRaw. UFRaw supports color management workflow based on Little CMS, allowing the user to apply ICC color profiles. For Nikon users UFRaw has the advantage that it can read the camera's tone curves. Even if you don't own a Nikon, you can still apply a Nikon curve to your images.

use.flag: Enable support for EXIF and XMP metadata through media-gfx/exiv2
Enable support for the FITS image format through sci-libs/cfitsio
Install gnome-base/gconf schemas and desktop file, and register UFRaw as being able to open raw files
enable DST correction for file timestamps
